direction.raw_text: Most of the sequences in this production are filmed using a hand- held camera or a Steadycam. These very mobile cameras move around the set, and get constantly closer and further from the characters. Still, we'll be using the usual technical terms, such as long shot or full shot or medium shot here and there to give the reader an idea of the location of the camera at the beginning of each sequence. And then we'll mention the movements of the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SITTING-ROOM - INTERIOR NIGHT Ted is lying on a large comfortable sofa, sipping beer from a bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what you do if you don't want an autopsy. You don't want something discovered, you know ? Like-like poison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - KITCHEN - INTERIOR NIGHT Carol is still standing up, the telephone handset stuck between her ear and her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mm. Right. They'd have detected poison, wouldn't they ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SITTING-ROOM - INTERIOR NIGHT TED Uh, I don't know. There's a lot of different kinds of exotic poisons, you know ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FRONT HALL - INTERIOR NIGHT Full shot of the kitchen, seen from the hall. Carol is still standing up but now she holding the phone handset with her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but why would he... Why would he be lying ? I mean, why-why would he lie at all ? Larry walks back into the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, you're up to poisons already. You guys are slipping into a mad obsession.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Oh, would you do that ? Because... That'd be great. Because, you know, I'm not good at that kind of thing, okay ? All right. Okay. Well, I'll talk to you later. Okay, bye. She puts the phone back on its hook on the wall
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go to bed. Could we go to bed, now ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I'm not tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, You're not tired ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Ted's gonna check with the funeral home, tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I mean ? I mean, I don't understand why you're not, not more fascinated with this. We could be living next door to a murderer, Larry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, New York is a melting pot. You know, get used to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BEDROOM - INTERIOR NIGHT Later in the night. Medium shot on the bed. Larry is asleep, but Carol is not. She moves in the bed, and then sits up. She turns around, pats her pillow, and tries to lie back on her side. But she sits up again, looking around the room. Eventually, she gets out of the bed. She walks around the bed in the dark, and switches on the lights in the corridor. The camera follows her in the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FRONT HALL - INTERIOR NIGHT Carol switches the lights on in the hall, then she looks into the peephole in the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God ! The camera turns around toward the corridor. Larry is getting out of the bedroom, putting his slippers on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, are you okay ? Carol walks in the corridor toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry. Larry, I heard a noise. I-I-I heard a noise in the hallway, so I just... I... You know, I-I looked and I think... I think Mr. House was getting on the elevator. Larry hops toward her, still trying to put his slippers on. She backs up and they are now both in the front hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah ? You're sure ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, you know, I was... I'm-I'm... almost certain that it was him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So-So-So what ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just, you know... I mean, who else could it be ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what ? It's not a crime. He can get on the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I know. But wh-who would it be at one-thirty in the morning ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jesus. I was in a deep sleep. What-What's the difference ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, you mean, you know how we're always complaining about living on the geriatric floor. Do you know what I'm saying ? A joke ? While Larry is answering her, Carol opens the front door and peeks into the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, so it was Mr. House. So he got on the elevator. It's not a felony. The guy pays rent. He's entitled. I mean, what... Can you go back to bed ? This is crazy. You woke me up out of a deep sleep. I gotta get up early tomorrow morning. Carol closes the door, and walks toward the kitchen. The camera follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - KITCHEN - INTERIOR NIGHT Carol looks through a notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what I'm gonna do. I'm gonna ring him up. I'm gonna ring his apartment. I'm gonna see if he's home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) You're gonna ring Mr. House, now ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, because this is really...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) What are you talking about ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very sus... Larry joins Carol when she already has the handset in her hand. But she succeeds in dialing Paul's number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't ring Mr... What are you doing ? No, don't ring...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me just... Larry, don't. Wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't ring Mr. house. This is a widower. Leave the poor guy alone. You're crazy. Stop it. Carol listens to the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's one ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you saw him go out. It's not a-not a crime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, two rings. He's not there, yet. Larry takes the handset from Carol's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me this. Give me this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, if you want to find out if somebody left, just call downstairs. Call the-the-the person at the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, I'll call. Just keep ringing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask if someone went out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep ringing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, um. Sure, I'm gonna keep ringing. You got it. While Carol walks out of the kitchen, Larry puts the phone back on its hook on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, man. Carol walks into the hall. The camera follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FRONT HALL - INTERIOR NIGHT LARRY (voice over) This is insane. What's gotten into you ? Carol picks up the building internal telephone handset from the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. What is he doing ? Where is this guy at one- thirty in the morning ? You know what I'm saying ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) It's not your business. He can go any place he wants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in the phone) Hallo ? Yes, hallo. This is Mrs. Lipton. Yes. Did anybody just leave the building ? I'm just... hmm. You're sure ? You're sure no one ? No, okay. All right. Yes. Thank you. While she was talking on the phone, the camera has moved toward Larry, standing at the entrance of the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Are you happy ? We hear the noise of the phone being put back on its hook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe this. Man, I don't get it. Larry joins his wife in the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, can we back to bed ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For crying out loud, it's no big deal. You're making a mystery where nothing exists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just let me think about this a second. Okay, I got it. Wait. I know, it... No, wait. Listen to me. Larry... Listen. He got on the elevator, okay ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I'm gonna...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, wait. No, no, listen to this. No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna go to sleep. I don't want to be standing here in the middle of the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Larry, he got on the elevator and he took it to the basement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, great ! Great ! So what ? Now, what've you got ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has a car, right ? He's got the garage door key, he opened... he could... he has the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what ? So what ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, so what ? He's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the big deal ? So, the next-door neighbor went out in the middle of the night and took his car. So, he went someplace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. So, I'm right, though. She starts walking back to the bedroom. Larry follows her. The camera remains in the front hall, filming them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, I'm right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, so you're right. So big deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, he isn't in his apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this kind of right is gonna put us in the toilet. So, you're right. You're suspicious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It says more about your mind that about him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about your rigidity ? How about that ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get into bed. Get into bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about that point ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're so... What's wrong with you ? Jesus ! They disappear in the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LARRY'S RESIDENCE STREET - EXTERIOR DAY Long shot on the crossroad between the street where Larry's residence is located and another street. Carol is crossing the street. She stops walking while on the crosswalk. The camera zooms on her and we see an expression of surprise on her face. Reverse angle long shot on the entrance of Larry's building. Paul comes out of the building. The camera zooms on him : he looks around him as if afraid to be followed. Reverse angle shot on Carol looking at him from a distance. She enters her building. She smiles to the attendant on duty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BASEMENT - INTERIOR DAY Full shot of Carol walking down the staircase leading to the basement. We see her through the glass panel of a heavy metal safety door. She opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack ? The camera follows Carol to a reverse angle shot showing the workshop of Jack, the factotum caretaker of the building. With a screwdriver and a plier in his hands, he is working on something we don't see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack, do you think you could come upstairs today, because I got a leak in the kitchen ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yeah. Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, but, it will be this afternoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I... I got...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, you're not gonna go now ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be back in about a minute. Jack walks out of his workshop and along one of the basement corridors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, just wait a second. I'll be right back. The camera follows Jack walking away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Yeah. Okay. All right. Oh, God. The camera turns around to a reverse angle shot on Carol, still in the workshop. She looks around, apparently looking for something. She peeks through the door of the workshop, to make sure Jack is not coming back too early. Carol rushes to a key-box on the wall, into which there is a spare key for every apartment in the building. She selects a key, takes it out of the box and puts it in her pocket. Then she leaves the workshop toward the staircase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - HALLWAY - INTERIOR DAY Full shot of the hallway. Carol comes out of the elevator, and looks around her. She walks back and forth in the hallway, before coming back to Paul's apartment door, just in front of the elevator. She opens the door with the key she has just stolen in Jack's workshop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CORRIDOR - INTERIOR DAY Full shot of the front door, seen from the living room. The front corridor is completely dark. The door opens and Carol walks in. She closes the door behind her. Carol walks toward the living room, and the light coming from the windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - KITCHEN - INTERIOR DAY Carol crosses the kitchen. She kneels down to look into the cupboard where she had found the funeral urn. Apparently the urn is not there anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A STREET - EXTERIOR DAY Long shot on a crosswalk in New-York. Paul is crossing the street. The camera zooms on Paul. He has almost crossed the street, but he suddenly stops a few feet from the next sidewalk. He feels his jacket : apparently he has forgotten something in his apartment. He turns around and starts walking back on the crosswalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - KITCHEN - INTERIOR DAY Carol is still looking in all the cupboards of the kitchen. She gets out of the kitchen into the living-room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIVING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY The camera pans around the room, following Carol, who looks inside every piece of furniture in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A STREET - EXTERIOR DAY Medium shot of Paul walking along the sidewalk, going back toward his apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIVING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Carol has picked up a few papers from a low table, and is looking at them. She puts her hand into her trouser pocket to get her glasses out. She puts her glasses on to have a better look at the documents she has found.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LOBBY - INTERIOR DAY Through the window of the lobby, we get a full shot of Paul coming toward the entrance of the building. An attendant rushes to open the door for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIVING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Carol is sitting at the desk. She has opened the drawer of the desk and is looking through its content. She takes an Air France ticket folder out of the drawer and looks inside it. Then she picks up another one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LOBBY - INTERIOR DAY Medium shot of Paul entering the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIVING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Carol closes the drawer of the desk. She stands up and picks up the phone from the desk and starts dialing a number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SITTING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Full shot of the room, which is quite wide. Ted is seated at his desk, and the shot is taken from the other side of the room, showing Ted's back. The phone rings. Ted picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hallo ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIVING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Medium close shot of Carol speaking on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ted... I'm in his apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ELEVATOR - INTERIOR DAY Medium close shot of Paul inside the cabin of the elevator. He gives a quick look up to the floor numbers above the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIVING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Same shot of Carol on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The urn is missing. It's gone. Yeah, I think it might have been. He had this satchel last night. He was carrying this bag, and I think that might have been what he had in his satchel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SITTING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Close shot of Ted's back. He is still seated at his desk and talking on the phone
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, I'd get out of there right away, if I were you. The camera moves around Ted, showing the typewriter he is typing on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no. Go, go, go. We'll do... We'll talk more from your apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIVING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Same shot of Carol on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not going snorkeling with his brother. He's got two tickets to Paris, and he's got reservations at the Georges Cinq hotel with a woman named Helen Moss. She turns around, because she feels she heard a noise in the landing hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - HALLWAY - INTERIOR DAY One of Paul's neighbor is standing in the hallway, waiting for the elevator. He's got some documents in his hand. The elevator dings and the door opens. Paul comes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Hi. How are you ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning. How are you ? Paul has his key in his hand and is ready to open his apartment door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. You got the notice on the... Uh, maintenance increase ? Paul turns around to look at the neighbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. When did that happen ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIVING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Close shot on Carol, whispering in the phone and looking toward the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna look around and see what else I can dig up here, okay ? Yeah. I'm telling you, this is just... Ted, I-I'm just dizzy with freedom. This is just... uh, this is just the craziest thing I've ever done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SITTING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Close-up shot on the ashtray, where a cigarette is burning slowly. The camera pans to a close-up shot on Paul's face, still on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it's crazy. But soon, we'll be too old to do anything crazy. Go, leave, leave, leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIVING-ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Carol puts the phone down on the desk. She stands and turns around when she hears the front door opening. Black screen shot on the front door in the dark of the corridor, then the camera quickly spins around to show Carol, standing in the living-room, with a frightened look on her face. She walks away from the room. The camera spins back to the front door, which opens. Paul enters and switches the lights on. He closes the front door, and walks along the corridor to the living-room. Carol walks into the kitchen from the living-room. The camera pans to Paul, looking for something on his desk. He looks through all the documents scattered on the desk. The camera pans back to Carol, hiding in the kitchen, then back to Paul. Paul opens both his hands in a gesture of despair : apparently, he hasn't found what he was looking for. He starts walking across the room, and the camera pans back to Carol in the kitchen. She rushes out of the kitchen. The camera remains at the same spot, and we see Paul in the living-room, still looking for whatever he is missing. He walks out of the living-room through the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BEDROOM - INTERIOR DAY Paul enters the room, looking in the inner pocket of his jacket. He walks around the room, and opens a closet. He looks through the hanging clothes, and finds a few documents in one of the jackets. He closes the closet, and starts looking through the documents he has found. He puts them inside the inner pocket of his jacket. He starts walking out of the room, when the phone rings. He stops and picks up the phone receiver on one of the night-tables.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hallo. Medium shot of Carol hiding under the bed. We notice she doesn't have her glasses anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Oh, hi. Yeah. I know. I-I...Yes, I miss you, too. I did. I made all the arrangements. Back to Paul standing by the bed and talking in the telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, look. I... Okay, I have to run. But I'll see you later, okay ? Okay. He puts the phone down on its hook, and starts walking out of the room. He stops, thinks for a couple of seconds, turns around, sits on the bed and picks up the phone. Back to Carol under the bed. The bed frame hits her back when Paul sits on it. She looks up. We hear Paul dialing a number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Extension five. Well, keep ringing, would you please ? Because I just talked to her. What ? Okay. Uh, will you tell her... yes, tell her that Tom called. Tom. Thank you. Back to Paul sitting on the bed. He puts the phone down on its hook, stands up and starts walking out of the room. Back to Carol under the bed, waiting for Paul to get out of his apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A STREET - EXTERIOR DAY Starting from street level, the camera tilts up along a very modern office building, all glass and steel. A sign, above the main entrance, says 10 East 53. This is the building where Larry's office is located.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Full shot of a large office room. In the forefront, a reception desk, with a young female receptionist talking to someone we still don't see. Coming from the other end of the room, Larry is walking with Marcia, a tall dark-haired lady, wearing sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, I thought your rewrites were great. I really think you helped your book, you know ? It's... It's dense a little bit, but, uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I don't want it to be too transparent, I mean... They are now at the reception desk level, and, since the camera is following them, we can see the young gentleman the receptionist is talking with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's... That's something you're never gonna have to worry about, you know ? This book makes Finnegan's Wake look like airplane reading, you know ? But-But it's long. It's- It's-It's... They are now walking along a corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you're the only editor in the world I'll take suggestions from, but even you shouldn't push it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not pushing it. I think the book is great. Absolutely great. You know, but, uh... how much, how much of Dorothy is you? As I was reading it, I kept thinking how much is... you know, how much did you base it on your own life ? They have now reached a smaller room, actually Larry's private room. Marcia takes her glasses off, and then her coat, and sits on a sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I was a waitress. I lived with a poet. I was a film critic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Right, but not-not a blackjack dealer, right ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but I put myself through school playing poker. The camera pans to Larry, who is standing up at the other end of the room, looking through some documents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, really ? Do you still play ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) No, but I still know how.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes ? Are you good ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, because maybe you could give me some pointers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) I could turn your game around in two hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could you ? That's great. That's... you know, you-you have all these skills, and you're beautiful, and you can write so well... and now it turns out you play poker. This is, uh, too good to be true. Larry sits down with the pile of documents on his laps. The camera pans back to Marcia. She has a cigarette in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I wouldn't say beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Oh, I would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I do have tremendous sex-appeal. The camera pans back to Larry, who is looking through the huge pile of paper on his laps, perhaps a manuscript.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, you sold me. Are-are you seeing anybody ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) No. Don't let my confidence fool you, it's a facade. Why do you ask ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I have a friend who became single recently, and I-I know he would get a big kick out of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Oh. So, when do you want your poker lessons ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, next week. I could take you to lunch. We could-we could, um, I'll put you on my expense account, and you could... teach me when to... bet and when to fold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) How about a cheeseburger right now ? The phone rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now ? That's a possibility. Larry picks up the phone from a small table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, we could, we could do... (talking into the telephone) Hallo. Yes ? Where are you ? The camera pans back to Marcia, who listens to Larry, smoking her cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Is everything okay ? Really ? No, I could, sure. The camera pans back to Larry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could. Yeah. I need-I need, you know, five minutes, or so. Okay. Yes. Yes. I know where it is. Okay, hold on. He puts the telephone down on its hook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do it. I have to... My wife, I have a little thing I have to do. I'll do the cheeseburger with you next week, or something. The camera pans back to Marcia, who is smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Story of my life ! She crushes her cigarette in and ashtray and stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A PARK - EXTERIOR DAY Full shot of a round concrete pond, with a fountain in the middle pouring water. In the background, a meadow, with chairs scattered on it. Carol is standing by the pond. Larry is talking to her, looking very nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, you snuck into his apartment ? Are you nuts ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, stop being such a fuddy-dud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fuddy-dud ? Carol starts walking around the pond. Larry follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about ? That's a crime. You can't do that. You... That's-That's burglary and breaking and entering. But... What has gotten into you lately ? For crying out loud, save a little craziness for menopause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a cinch. I took the key and I just let myself in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, look. Do... I don't want to... You-You'll wind up rooming with John Gotti. You can't do that. You can't just steal the key and then go into somebody's apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen. He's not going snorkeling with his brother, okay ? Okay ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't wanna know. I don't wanna be an accessory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going to Paris, to a fancy hotel with a woman named Helen Moss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell Ted. I don't want to know. Leave me alone. They keep on walking around the pond, the camera following them from a fixed location. They are now hidden by the fountain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over from behind the fountain) I told Ted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over from behind the fountain) You told Ted before you told me ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Everett Sloane - voice over from the film) I knew I'd find you two together. Arthur's figure, walking with a cane, is reflected in the many mirrors in the film. While Gladys and Paul are talking, the film keeps on showing on the screen behind them, but we do not understand the words from the film, because Paul and Gladys' voices are louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hallo, Paul. Didn't you expect me ? Medium shot on the mirrors, showing several reflections of Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Dalton. Close shot on Gladys' face. While she is talking, the camera pans away from her, showing her reflection on a mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You made a lot of promises to me, over the years. And then, you decided to dump me for that young model. The camera keeps on panning, showing another reflection of Gladys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) I never led you on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a very harsh voice) It's late for excuses. Medium shot on the mirrors showing several reflections of Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None of you can prove anything. Full shot of the screen, showing Arthur and his numerous reflections on the mirrors in the film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Everett Sloane - voice over from the film) So you'd be foolish to fire that gun. Low angle shot on the staircase, showing Larry going down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Everett Sloane - voice over from the film) With these mirrors, it's difficult to tell. You are aiming at me, aren't you ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol ? Carol ? Carol ? Medium shot of Gladys and one of her reflections.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm aiming at you, lover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Everett Sloane - voice over from the film) Of course, killing you is killing myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, killing you is killing myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Everett Sloane - voice over from the film) It's the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you know, I'm pretty tired of both of us. She fired her gun twice Medium shot on the many reflections of Paul. He fires his gun twice. We hear noises of mirrors being broken by the gunshots, both in the film, and on the backstage itself. Medium shot of Gladys and one of her reflections. She turns around, not being sure, because of the mirrors, of Paul's exact location. Medium shot of Paul walking on the backstage. We still hears noises of mirrors being broken, but we don't know if the noises come from the film or the backstage. Medium shot of Gladys and several of the reflections. Medium shot of the floor of the backstage. We see the bottom of the screen and, of course, the film projected on it, and in which the mirrors are being broken. Paul enters from behind a mirror frame, and falls on the floor. Gladys' reflection appears in several mirrors. She stops and looks at Paul's body lying on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - OLD DRESSING ROOM - INTERIOR DAY Medium close shot of Larry entering the room. He rushes to Carol, and takes her gag off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God ! Are you okay ? Are you okay ? He hugs and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God, Larry ! Oh, Larry, I'm so happy to see you !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, I was, I was never so glad to see somebody in my life. Are you all right ? He starts untying her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know what's going on out there. I'll never say that life doesn't imitate art again. I'm... I'm... Oh, gee...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We... we gotta call the police, Larry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, and... and... and... a glazier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Oh, God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quick, quick. Dial, dial, dial. He picks up the telephone, and Carol, whose hands are now completely free, starts dialing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry. Oh, God, Larry. Oh, God. Oh, honey. Oh, God. Ow ! Ow ! Oh, God ! Jesus ! Larry hugs and kisses her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Oh, wife mine. He takes the rope away, but he does it so nervously that he almost takes Carol's head off !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aow ! Aow ! (talking in the phone) Hello ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wife mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: STREET IN FRONT OF THE POLICE STATION

direction.raw_text: - STREET IN FRONT OF THE POLICE STATION - EXTERIOR DAY Medium close shot on the top part of the door of the police station. A sign says : 4th precinct 621. The camera tilts down. Three uniformed policemen are standing on the sidewalk near the door. Marcia and Ted come out of the station, and stop at the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, it's... it's so complicated. I can't... Can't keep track of it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, listen. I'll give it to you one more time. Marcia takes a cigarette, and Ted lights it with his lighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIVING ROOM - INTERIOR NIGHT Medium shot. It's dinner time in Paul's apartment. Paul and Lilian's sister are seated around the table. Lilian comes in from
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Mrs. House had a sister who moved to England many years ago. Lilian gives a glass of wine to her sister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) She changed her name when she married. Lilian gives a glass of wine to Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Her husband died. She moved back to New York recently, a very, very rich widow... but a recluse. Lilian's sister has a heart attack. Paul helps her walk away from the table to the sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Mr. and Mrs. House knew they weren't in her will. They have her over to dinner, she accidentally keels over. I guessed right there. Lilian's sister is lying dead on the sofa, and Lilian, wearing a pink night-robe, is dressing her sister in her own clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) She has a reasonable resemblance to her sister, so they fake it... Pretend Lillian House died. They cremate the sister. The camera pans to Paul talking on the telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) Lillian checks into a fleabag joint... and for several weeks she pretends to be her sister... closing her accounts, liquidating her assets, accumulating big money. The camera pans back to the sofa, where Lilian is still dressing her sister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (voice over) What she didn't realize was that her husband was two-timing her with Helen Moss, this pretty model.
direction.name: direction
